channel.title: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!
channel.description:
[code]Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601] Copyright (c) 2009 Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
C:\Users\***>ipconfig 'ipconfig' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.[/code]

item.title: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[quote=“Valazar, post:4, topic:459830”]You need to be an administrator, Right click cmd and run as administrator.[/quote]THANK YOU! Rep++.

Read full topic

item.source: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!

item.title: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!
item.dc:creator: @Virgin Virgin
item.description:
@Virgin wrote:

[quote=“brynd63, post:2, topic:459830”]In your environmental variables, remove the path and classpath to jdk/jre if you have set it in the SYSTEM VARIABLES
keep the user variables though.
http://screensnapr.com/v/u1Dw0E.jpg

Also try restarting your pc… I don’t know how I fixed it on my computer but try that :S[/quote]
I have my Environmental Variables correct though…? But typing “ipconfig” in “cmd” doesn’t work…

Read full topic
item.source: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!

item.title: Ipconfig not recognized.. HELP <-- Can I get some of that?!
item.dc:creator: @brynd63 brynd63
item.description:
@brynd63 wrote:

In your environmental variables, remove the path and classpath to jdk/jre if you have set it in the SYSTEM VARIABLES
keep the user variables though.
http://screensnapr.com/v/u1Dw0E.jpg

Also try restarting your pc… I don’t know how I fixed it on my computer but try that :S

Read full topic
